channel.title: [PI] Changing the RuneScape logo to your own!
channel.description:
[b]Difficulty: 1/10 Purpose: Changing the RuneScape logo on a Project Insanity client to your own logo. Note: This is for Project Insanity clients only. For other clients, the logo should be in the Sprites folder.[/b]
Step 1: Downloading a Cache Editor (Tom's Cache Suite) Click [url=http://www.evoscape.net/Cache_Editor.rar]here[/url] to download.
Step 2: Extract it to your desktop using WinRar. Click [url=http://www.rarlab.com]here[/url] to download WinRar.
Step 3: Navigate through the "Suite" folder. Open the JAR file named "Suite.jar" It should look like this: [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/2jfnmq.jpg[/img]
Step 4: Go to File, then hit "Load Cache..." Once you hit Load Cache... navigate to your clients cache folder. It should look like this: [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/j9n2gg.jpg[/img]
Step 5: Once you selected your cache, on the toolkit, select "View/Edit Image Archives" It should look like this: [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/fyho9c.jpg[/img]
Step 6: Once you clicked on that, it will say "What type of image do you wish to edit?" Select Title, and hit ok. [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/8xvcdy.jpg[/img]
Step 7: Click on the logo.dat (As shown in the picture below), then hit "Import" to import your logo/image. Once you've done that, click "Save Archive" You [b]must[/b] do that so it rebuilds the cache and saves the logo. [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/118h8r6.jpg[/img]
Congratulations. You have changed the RuneScape logo into your own! Run your client to see the effects. Also, you can change the login box and the login button the same way.
Before: [IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/2zputua.jpg[/img]
After: (I just put in a random image to show that it works) [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/2uf3ot1.jpg[/img]
Hope this helped people. Some people asked me on MSN how to do it, that's why I posted this tutorial.
Should you need further help, you can add me on MSN and I'll help you. (evoze@live.com)
:)

item.title: [PI] Changing the RuneScape logo to your own!
item.dc:creator: @xEvo Exion
item.description:
@xEvo wrote:

[quote=“developer, post:6, topic:354463”]k im gunna do this and see if this helps me with the error im gettin on my webclient
it fails to load the title screen the says trying again in 5…10…15 and so on
ill let u know if it of actual help to me by tomorrow i got a long list of stuff to do lol[/quote]
That has nothing to do with changing the logo. Make sure your webclient is downloading the cache from the correct place.

item.title: [PI] Changing the RuneScape logo to your own!
item.dc:creator: @xEvo Exion
item.description:
@xEvo wrote:

Difficulty: 1/10
Purpose: Changing the RuneScape logo on a Project Insanity client to your own logo.
Note: This is for Project Insanity clients only. For other clients, the logo should be in the Sprites folder.

Step 1: Downloading a Cache Editor (Tom’s Cache Suite)
Click here to download.

Step 2: Extract it to your desktop using WinRar.
Click here to download WinRar.

Step 3: Navigate through the “Suite” folder. Open the JAR file named “Suite.jar”
It should look like this:

2jfnmq.jpg898×700

Step 4: Go to File, then hit “Load Cache…”
Once you hit Load Cache… navigate to your clients cache folder. It should look like this:

Step 5: Once you selected your cache, on the toolkit, select “View/Edit Image Archives”
It should look like this:

Step 6: Once you clicked on that, it will say “What type of image do you wish to edit?”
Select Title, and hit ok.

Step 7: Click on the logo.dat (As shown in the picture below), then hit “Import” to import your logo/image. Once you’ve done that, click “Save Archive” You must do that so it rebuilds the cache and saves the logo.

118h8r6.jpg599×549

Congratulations. You have changed the RuneScape logo into your own! Run your client to see the effects. Also, you can change the login box and the login button the same way.

Before:

2zputua.jpg763×502

After: (I just put in a random image to show that it works)

2uf3ot1.jpg766×503

Hope this helped people. Some people asked me on MSN how to do it, that’s why I posted this tutorial.

Should you need further help, you can add me on MSN and I’ll help you. (evoze@live.com)

Read full topic
